title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement codeofconduct@posit.co. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: outlines propose change osrm.backend. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("e-kotov/osrm.backend", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to osrm.backend
text: Please note osrm.backend project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

text: Armed reprex, next step figure ask. ’s question: start community.rstudio.com, /StackOverflow. people answer questions. ’s bug: ’re right place, file issue. ’re sure: let community help figure ! problem bug feature request, can easily return report . opening new issue, sure search issues pull requests make sure bug hasn’t reported /already fixed development version. default, search pre-populated :issue :open. can edit qualifiers (e.g. :pr, :closed) needed. example, ’d simply remove :open search issues repo, open closed.

Typically don’t look repo sufficient quantity issues accumulates, ’s burst intense activity focus efforts. makes development efficient avoids expensive context switching problems, cost taking longer get back . process makes good reprex particularly important might multiple months initial report start working . can’t reproduce bug, can’t fix !

what: Create a temporary directory and copy example OSM PBF file into it
title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
code: osrm_temp_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-data-", Sys.getpid())) dir.create(osrm_temp_dir, showWarnings = FALSE, recursive = TRUE) internal_pbf <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend") file.copy(from = internal_pbf, to = osrm_temp_dir)

title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
text: Start server osrm_start() function pointing temporary directory created . automatically check OSRM Backend binaries installed, , install latest version, also automatically prepare routing graph OSM PBF file already done start server. steps unnecessary, skip , running funciton lead re-downloading OSRM binaries re-processing OSM PBF file already done. Tip: can check server running osrm_servers(): can kill server osrm_stop() osrm_stop_all() started several servers.
code: osrm_start(osrm_temp_dir, verbose = TRUE) # A tibble: 1 × 7   id                                   pid  port algorithm started_at          alive has_handle   <chr>                              <int> <int> <chr>     <dttm>              <lgl> <lgl> 1 osrm-28034-5001-20251103122904.133 28034  5001 MLD       2025-11-03 00:00:00 TRUE  TRUE

title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
text: Load spatial data OSM PBF file sample points routing plot street network:
code: # read the pbf file with sf osm_points <- read_sf(internal_pbf, layer = "points") osm_streets <- read_sf(internal_pbf, layer = "multilinestrings")  set.seed(100) sampled_points <- osm_points[sample(nrow(osm_points), 2), ]

title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
text: use osrm package local server, set osrm.server option point local server URL. default port osrm_start() uses 5001, URL http://localhost:5001/. can use osrm function usual, calculate route two sampled points:
code: options("osrm.server" = "http://localhost:5001/") route <- osrm::osrmRoute(loc = sampled_points) route Simple feature collection with 1 feature and 4 fields Geometry type: LINESTRING Dimension:     XY Bounding box:  xmin: -49.27156 ymin: -25.43082 xmax: -49.25396 ymax: -25.42358 Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84           src dst duration distance                       geometry 3786_503 3786 503     5.55   2.6324 LINESTRING (-49.25534 -25.4...

what: Plot the route on top of the street network
title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
code: plot(st_geometry(osm_streets), lwd = 0.5, col = "grey70") plot(st_geometry(route), col = "red", lwd = 5, add = TRUE)

what: Stop local OSRM server and cleanup
title: Quick Start: Install OSRM and calculate routes
text: can now stop server: remove temporary directory:
code: osrm_stop() Stopped OSRM server id=osrm-29557-5001-20251103124028.405 (pid 29557, port 5001). unlink(osrm_temp_dir, recursive = TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Egor Kotov. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kotov E (2025). Bindings 'Open Source Routing Machine'. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.osrm.backend, https://github.com/e-kotov/osrm.backend. Giraud, T. (2022). osrm: Interface R OpenStreetMap-Based Routing Service OSRM. Journal Open Source Software, 7(78), 4574, https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.04574
code: @Manual{osrm.backend,   title = {Bindings for 'Open Source Routing Machine'},   author = {Egor Kotov},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/e-kotov/osrm.backend},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.osrm.backend}, } @Article{,   title = {{osrm: Interface Between R and the OpenStreetMap-Based Routing Service OSRM}},   author = {Timothee Giraud},   journal = {Journal of Open Source Software},   year = {2022},   month = {aug},   publisher = {The Open Journal},   volume = {7},   number = {78},   pages = {4574},   doi = {10.21105/joss.04574},   url = {https://doi.org/10.21105/joss.04574}, }

what: Bindings for Open Source Routing Machine
title: Bindings for Open Source Routing Machine
text: goal osrm.backend companion osrm R package https://github.com/riatelab/osrm: provide single line quick start osmr_start() function everything automatically run local OSRM backend server, setup required; easily install osrm.backend major operating systems (Linux, Windows, MacOS); provide wrapper functions prepare data osrm routing; provide wrapper start/stop local OSRM backend server.

title: Bindings for Open Source Routing Machine
text: Install latest stable release osrm.backend CRAN : can install development version osrm.backend R Universe : GitHub repo : can prepare OpenStreetMap data routing one function osrm_start(<path_to_osm_file_or_folder_with_osm_file>), set osrm.server option http://localhost:5001/ use osrm functions usual. need osrm-backend installed Docker run osrm-backend container, everything handled automatically major operating systems. Just follow Get started guide. advanced control step process, see full function reference.
code: # soon on CRAN, watch this space! install.packages('osrm.backend',  repos = c('https://e-kotov.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org') ) # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("e-kotov/osrm.backend")

what: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: Queries GitHub API get list available version tags OSRM backend binaries current platform.

code: osrm_check_available_versions(prereleases = FALSE)

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: prereleases logical value. TRUE, include pre-release versions returned list. Defaults FALSE.

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
text: character vector available version tags.

title: Check for Available OSRM Versions — osrm_check_available_versions
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   # Get all stable versions with binaries for this platform   osrm_check_available_versions() } # }

code: osrm_check_latest_version()

title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
text: string containing latest version tag (e.g., "v5.27.1").

title: Check for the Latest Stable OSRM Version — osrm_check_latest_version
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   # Get the latest stable version number of OSRM backend   osrm_check_latest_version() } # }

what: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
text: Remove OSRM-generated files directory. useful switching algorithms (CH MLD) want start fresh.

title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
code: osrm_cleanup(path, keep_osm = TRUE, dry_run = FALSE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
text: path string. Path OSRM file directory containing OSRM files. file path provided (e.g., data.osm.pbf data.osrm.hsgr), base name extracted related .osrm.* files removed. keep_osm Logical. TRUE (default), keeps original .osm.pbf (.osm, .osm.bz2) file. FALSE, removes well. dry_run Logical. TRUE, shows deleted without actually deleting. Default FALSE. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses messages. Default FALSE.

title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
text: Invisibly returns character vector removed file paths.

title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
text: OSRM creates many .osrm.* files extract, contract, partition, customize stages. function helps clean files. Important: CH MLD algorithms safely coexist directory MLD partition stage modifies extract-stage files. Use function clean switching algorithms.

title: Clean Up OSRM Files in a Directory — osrm_cleanup
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Stage a temporary workspace with placeholder OSRM files   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   file.create(     file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osrm.timestamp"),     file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osrm.hsgr"),     file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osrm.mldgr"),     file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osrm.partition")   )    # Preview what would be deleted   osrm_cleanup(osrm_dir, dry_run = TRUE)    # Clean up OSRM artifacts (keep the OSM file)   osrm_cleanup(osrm_dir)    # Remove everything including the OSM source   osrm_cleanup(osrm_dir, keep_osm = FALSE)    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: Scans .Rprofile file current project's root directory removes lines added osrm_install() modify PATH.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
code: osrm_clear_path(quiet = FALSE)

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses messages. Defaults FALSE.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
text: TRUE file modified, FALSE otherwise.

title: Clear OSRM Path from Project's .Rprofile — osrm_clear_path
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   # Clean up a temporary project's .Rprofile   old <- setwd(tempdir())   on.exit(setwd(old), add = TRUE)   writeLines(     c(       "#added-by-r-pkg-osrm.backend",       'Sys.setenv(PATH = paste("dummy", Sys.getenv("PATH"), sep = .Platform$path.sep))'     ),     ".Rprofile"   )   osrm_clear_path(quiet = TRUE)   unlink(".Rprofile") } # }

what: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: Run osrm-contract tool contract OSRM graph CH pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.hsgr file must exist confirm success.

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
code: osrm_contract(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   segment_speed_file = NULL,   turn_penalty_file = NULL,   edge_weight_updates_over_factor = 0,   parse_conditionals_from_now = 0,   time_zone_file = NULL,   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   spinner = TRUE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: input_osrm string. Path .osrm.timestamp file, base path .osrm files (without extension), directory containing exactly one .osrm.timestamp file. threads integer. Number threads use; default 8. verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". segment_speed_file string NULL. Path nodeA,nodeB,speed CSV; default NULL. turn_penalty_file string NULL. Path from_,to_,via_nodes,penalties CSV; default NULL. edge_weight_updates_over_factor numeric. Threshold logging large weight updates; default 0. parse_conditionals_from_now numeric. UTC timestamp conditional restrictions; default 0. time_zone_file string NULL. GeoJSON file time zone boundaries; default NULL. quiet logical. Master switch suppresses package messages process output TRUE; default FALSE. verbose logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, streams stdout stderr underlying processx::run calls. spinner logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, shows spinner instead live logs; default TRUE. echo_cmd logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, prints command running; default FALSE.

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
text: object class osrm_job following elements: osrm_job_artifact path contracted .osrm.hsgr file. osrm_working_dir directory containing OSRM files. logs processx::run result object.

title: Contract OSRM Graph for Contraction Hierarchies (CH) — osrm_contract
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Prepare a small graph then contract it for the CH pipeline   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   profile <- osrm_find_profile("car.lua")    extract_job <- osrm_extract(     input_osm = tmp_pbf,     profile = profile,     overwrite = TRUE,     threads = 1L   )    ch_graph <- osrm_contract(extract_job, threads = 1L, verbose = TRUE)   ch_graph$osrm_job_artifact    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: Run osrm-customize tool customize partitioned OSRM graph MLD pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.mldgr file must exist confirm success.

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
code: osrm_customize(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   segment_speed_file = NULL,   turn_penalty_file = NULL,   edge_weight_updates_over_factor = 0,   parse_conditionals_from_now = 0,   time_zone_file = NULL,   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   spinner = TRUE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: input_osrm string. Path .osrm.partition file, base path partitioned .osrm files (without extension), directory containing exactly one .osrm.partition file. threads integer. Number threads use; default 8 (osrm-customize's default). verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". segment_speed_file string NULL. Path nodeA,nodeB,speed CSV; default NULL. turn_penalty_file string NULL. Path from_,to_,via_nodes,penalties CSV; default NULL. edge_weight_updates_over_factor numeric. Factor threshold logging large weight updates; default 0. parse_conditionals_from_now numeric. UTC timestamp evaluate conditional turn restrictions; default 0. time_zone_file string NULL. GeoJSON file time zone boundaries; default NULL. quiet logical. Master switch suppresses package messages process output TRUE; default FALSE. verbose logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, streams stdout stderr underlying processx::run calls. spinner logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, shows spinner instead live logs; default TRUE. echo_cmd logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, prints command running; default FALSE.

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
text: object class osrm_job following elements: osrm_job_artifact path customized .osrm.mldgr file. osrm_working_dir directory containing OSRM files. logs processx::run result object.

title: Customize OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_customize
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Partition then customize a graph for the MLD pipeline   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   profile <- osrm_find_profile("car.lua")    extract_job <- osrm_extract(     input_osm = tmp_pbf,     profile = profile,     overwrite = TRUE,     threads = 1L   )   partition_job <- osrm_partition(extract_job, threads = 1L)    mld_graph <- osrm_customize(partition_job, threads = 1L, verbose = TRUE)   mld_graph$osrm_job_artifact    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: Run osrm-extract tool preprocess OSM file (.osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf) base .osrm graph files using specified Lua profile.  running, companion <base>.osrm.timestamp file must exist confirm success.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
code: osrm_extract(   input_osm,   profile = osrm_find_profile("car.lua"),   threads = 8L,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   data_version = NULL,   small_component_size = 1000L,   with_osm_metadata = FALSE,   parse_conditional_restrictions = FALSE,   location_dependent_data = NULL,   disable_location_cache = FALSE,   dump_nbg_graph = FALSE,   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   spinner = TRUE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: input_osm string. Path input OSM file (.osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf) directory containing exactly one OSM file supported extension. profile string. Path OSRM Lua profile (e.g. returned osrm_find_profile("car.lua")). threads integer. Number threads -t/--threads; default 8 (OSRM's default). overwrite logical. FALSE (default), stops existing .osrm* files matching base name found alongside input_osm. Set TRUE proceed regardless. verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"), default "INFO". data_version string NULL. Passed -d/--data_version; default NULL, case option omitted. small_component_size integer. --small-component-size; default 1000 (OSRM's default). with_osm_metadata logical. TRUE, adds ---osm-metadata; default FALSE. parse_conditional_restrictions logical. TRUE, adds --parse-conditional-restrictions; default FALSE. location_dependent_data string NULL. Path GeoJSON, passed --location-dependent-data; default NULL, case option omitted. disable_location_cache logical. TRUE, adds --disable-location-cache; default FALSE. dump_nbg_graph logical. TRUE, adds --dump-nbg-graph; default FALSE. quiet logical. Master switch suppresses package messages process output TRUE; default FALSE. verbose logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, streams stdout stderr underlying processx::run calls. spinner logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, shows spinner instead live logs; default TRUE. echo_cmd logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, prints command running; default FALSE.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
text: object class osrm_job following elements: osrm_job_artifact path generated .osrm.timestamp file. osrm_working_dir directory containing OSRM files. logs processx::run result object.

title: Extract OSM into OSRM Graph Files — osrm_extract
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   # Install OSRM (temporary, session PATH)   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # copy example OSM PBF into a temporary workspace to avoid polluting pkg data   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)    # Find the path to the profile first   car_profile <- osrm_find_profile("car.lua")    # extract OSRM graph files   result <- osrm_extract(     input_osm                  = tmp_pbf,     profile                    = car_profile,     overwrite                  = TRUE,     threads                    = 1L   )   # path to generated .osrm files (specifically, the .osrm.timestamp file)   result$osrm_job_artifact    # Clean up binaries and workspace   osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: default OSRM ships profiles "car", "bike" "foot" profiles/ directory alongside binaries.  function try locate osrm-routed PATH, resolve symlinks, look first profiles/ directory next binary (placed osrm_install()). fails, looks sibling directories share/osrm/profiles share/osrm-backend/profiles. fails, try fall back /usr/local/share/osrm/profiles,/usr/local/share/osrm-backend/profiles, /usr/share/osrm/profiles, /usr/share/osrm-backend/profiles.

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
code: osrm_find_profile(profile = "car.lua")

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: profile single string, name Lua profile file (e.g. "car.lua"). Defaults "car.lua".

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
text: normalized filesystem path profile.

title: Locate an OSRM Lua profile (e.g. car.lua) in a host installation — osrm_find_profile
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )   osrm_find_profile("car.lua")   osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   ) } # }

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: Downloads installs pre-compiled binaries OSRM backend official GitHub releases. function automatically detects user's operating system architecture download appropriate files. latest v5 release (v5.27.1) v6.0.0 manually tested known work well; releases available GitHub can installed guranteed function correctly.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
code: osrm_install(   version = "latest",   dest_dir = NULL,   force = FALSE,   path_action = c("session", "project", "none"),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: version string specifying OSRM version tag install. Defaults "latest". Use "latest" automatically find recent stable version (internally calls osrm_check_latest_version()). Versions v5.27.1 v6.0.0 trigger warning still attempted binaries available. dest_dir string specifying directory OSRM binaries installed. NULL (default), user-friendly, persistent location chosen via tools::R_user_dir("osrm.backend", = "cache"), binaries installed subdirectory named OSRM version (e.g. .../cache/v6.0.0). force logical value. TRUE, reinstall OSRM even already found dest_dir. FALSE (default), function stop existing installation detected. path_action string specifying handle system PATH. One : "session" (default): Adds OSRM bin directory PATH current R session . "project": Modifies .Rprofile current project set PATH future sessions project. "none": modify PATH. quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses installer messages warnings. Defaults FALSE.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: path installation directory.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
text: function performs following steps: Queries GitHub API find specified release Project-OSRM/osrm-backend. Identifies correct binary (.tar.gz archive) user's OS (Linux, macOS, Windows) architecture (x64, arm64). Downloads archive temporary location. Extracts archive locates OSRM executables (e.g., osrm-routed, osrm-extract). Copies executables local directory (defaults file.path(tools::R_user_dir("osrm.backend", = "cache"), <version>)). Downloads matching Lua profiles release tarball installs alongside binaries. Optionally modifies PATH environment variable current session project. macOS users note upstream OSRM v6.x binaries built macOS 15.0 (Sequoia, Darwin 24.0.0) newer. osrm_install() automatically blocks v6 installs older macOS releases , version = "latest", selects recent v5 build instead warning requirement. Warnings include marketing version Darwin kernel see messages like macOS 13 Ventura [Darwin 22.6.0]. installing OSRM v6.x Windows, upstream release omits Intel Threading Building Blocks (TBB) runtime compatible bz2 DLL. keep executables runnable box, osrm_install() fetches TBB oneTBB v2022.3.0 BZip2 runtime bzip2-windows v1.0.8.0, verifying SHA-256 checksums extraction. Without extra libraries, OSRM v6 binaries shipped Windows start. macOS, OSRM v6.x binaries also miss bundled TBB runtime. installer reuses libraries release v5.27.1 keep binaries functional patches libbz2 linkage using install_name_tool load system-provided BZip2 runtime. Power users (including package authors running cross-platform tests) can override auto-detected platform setting R options osrm.backend.override_os osrm.backend.override_arch (e.g., options(osrm.backend.override_os = "linux", osrm.backend.override_arch = "arm64")) calling osrm_install(). Overrides allow requesting binaries OS CPU combination exists GitHub releases.

title: Install OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_install
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   old <- setwd(tempdir())   on.exit(setwd(old), add = TRUE)    # Install the default stable version and set PATH for this session   install_dir <- osrm_install(path_action = "session", quiet = TRUE)    # Install for a project non-interactively (e.g., in a script)   osrm_install(path_action = "project", quiet = TRUE, force = TRUE)    # Clean up the project's .Rprofile and uninstall binaries   osrm_clear_path(quiet = TRUE)   osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   ) } # }

what: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: Run osrm-partition tool partition OSRM graph MLD pipeline. running, companion <base>.osrm.partition file must exist confirm success.

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
code: osrm_partition(   input_osrm,   threads = 8L,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   balance = 1.2,   boundary = 0.25,   optimizing_cuts = 10L,   small_component_size = 1000L,   max_cell_sizes = c(128, 4096, 65536, 2097152),   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   spinner = TRUE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: input_osrm string. Path .osrm.timestamp file, base path .osrm files (without extension), directory containing exactly one .osrm.timestamp file. threads integer. Number threads use; default 8 (osrm-partition's default). verbosity string. Log verbosity level passed -l/--verbosity (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". balance numeric. Balance left right side single bisection; default 1.2. boundary numeric. Percentage embedded nodes contract sources sinks; default 0.25. optimizing_cuts integer. Number cuts use optimizing single bisection; default 10. small_component_size integer. Size threshold small components; default 1000. max_cell_sizes numeric vector. Maximum cell sizes starting level 1; default c(128,4096,65536,2097152). quiet logical. Master switch suppresses package messages process output TRUE; default FALSE. verbose logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, streams stdout stderr underlying processx::run calls. spinner logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, shows spinner instead live logs; default TRUE. echo_cmd logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, prints command running; default FALSE.

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
text: object class osrm_job following elements: osrm_job_artifact path partitioned .osrm.partition file. osrm_working_dir directory containing OSRM files. logs processx::run result object.

title: Partition OSRM Graph for Multi-Level Dijkstra (MLD) — osrm_partition
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Prepare a small graph then partition it for the MLD pipeline   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   profile <- osrm_find_profile("car.lua")    extract_job <- osrm_extract(     input_osm = tmp_pbf,     profile = profile,     overwrite = TRUE,     threads = 1L   )    partition_job <- osrm_partition(extract_job, threads = 1L, verbose = TRUE)   partition_job$osrm_job_artifact    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: High-level wrapper first runs osrm-extract OSM file produce base .osrm graph, prepares routing via either MLD pipeline (osrm-partition + osrm-customize) CH pipeline (osrm-contract).

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
code: osrm_prepare_graph(   input_osm,   profile = osrm_find_profile("car.lua"),   threads = 8L,   overwrite = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "NONE", "ERROR", "WARNING", "DEBUG"),   data_version = NULL,   small_component_size = 1000L,   with_osm_metadata = FALSE,   parse_conditional_restrictions = FALSE,   location_dependent_data = NULL,   disable_location_cache = FALSE,   dump_nbg_graph = FALSE,   algorithm = c("mld", "ch"),   balance = 1.2,   boundary = 0.25,   optimizing_cuts = 10L,   max_cell_sizes = c(128, 4096, 65536, 2097152),   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   spinner = TRUE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: input_osm string. Path input OSM file (.osm, .osm.bz2, .osm.pbf) directory containing exactly one OSM file supported extension. profile string. Path OSRM Lua profile (e.g. returned osrm_find_profile("car.lua")). threads integer. Number threads extract partition/contract; default 8. overwrite logical. FALSE, stops existing .osrm* files matching base name found alongside input_osm. Set TRUE overwrite . verbosity string. Log verbosity extract/partition/contract (one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG"); default "INFO". data_version string NULL. Passed osrm-extract via -d; default NULL. small_component_size integer. extract & partition; default 1000. with_osm_metadata logical. Adds ---osm-metadata extract; default FALSE. parse_conditional_restrictions logical. Adds --parse-conditional-restrictions; default FALSE. location_dependent_data string NULL. Path GeoJSON extract; default NULL. disable_location_cache logical. Adds --disable-location-cache; default FALSE. dump_nbg_graph logical. Adds --dump-nbg-graph; default FALSE. algorithm string. One "mld" (default) "ch". balance numeric. Balance osrm-partition; default 1.2. boundary numeric. Boundary percentage osrm-partition; default 0.25. optimizing_cuts integer. Optimizing cuts osrm-partition; default 10. max_cell_sizes numeric vector. Max cell sizes osrm-partition; default c(128,4096,65536,2097152). quiet logical. Master switch suppresses package messages process output TRUE; default FALSE. verbose logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, streams stdout stderr underlying processx::run calls. spinner logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, shows spinner instead live logs; default TRUE. echo_cmd logical. TRUE quiet = FALSE, prints command running; default FALSE.

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
text: object class osrm_job following elements: osrm_job_artifact path final routing-ready graph file (.osrm.hsgr CH .osrm.mldgr MLD). osrm_working_dir directory containing OSRM files. logs list processx::run results stage: extract, partition/contract, customize (MLD).

title: Prepare OSRM Graph for Routing (Extract + Partition/Contract) — osrm_prepare_graph
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Prepare a routing-ready graph with the default MLD pipeline   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)    graph <- osrm_prepare_graph(     input_osm = tmp_pbf,     overwrite = TRUE,     threads = 1L,     algorithm = "mld"   )   graph$osrm_job_artifact    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: List OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_servers
title: List OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_servers
text: Returns snapshot servers registered osrm_start_server() osrm_start(). can stop one passing id, port, pid osrm_stop().

title: List OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_servers
code: osrm_servers()

title: List OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_servers
text: data.frame columns: id, pid, port, algorithm, started_at, alive, has_handle.

title: List OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_servers
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # copy example OSM PBF into a temporary workspace to avoid polluting pkg data   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   graph <- osrm_prepare_graph(tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE, threads = 1L)    srv <- osrm_start_server(graph$osrm_job_artifact, port = 6000, threads = 1L)   osrm_servers()   osrm_stop(srv)    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
text: high-level, "one-shot" function start OSRM server automatically handles OSRM installation graph preparation. recommended function users get server running quickly minimal steps.

title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
code: osrm_start(   path,   algorithm = c("mld", "ch"),   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   ... )

title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
text: path string. Path input data. Can one : path OSM file (e.g., /path//data.osm.pbf). path directory containing OSRM graph files OSM file. direct path final graph file (.osrm.mldgr .osrm.hsgr). algorithm string specifying routing algorithm use graph preparation, either "mld" (Multi-Level Dijkstra, default) "ch" (Contraction Hierarchies). used osrm_prepare_graph automatically called. quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses installer messages warnings. Defaults FALSE. verbose logical. FALSE (default), suppresses detailed console output backend commands. TRUE, shows output, useful debugging. ... Additional arguments passed osrm_prepare_graph() (e.g., overwrite = TRUE) osrm_start_server() (e.g., port = 5001).

title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
text: processx::process object running server.

title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
text: function designed convenience automates entire setup process. default, verbose prints high-level status messages. Check OSRM Installation: first verifies osrm-routed executable available system's PATH. , automatically calls osrm_install() download install latest stable version. Process Input Path Prepare Graph: function intelligently handles path argument find create necessary graph files. graph files exist, automatically runs osrm_prepare_graph() build , may take time. Start Server: graph files located prepared, launches osrm-routed server prints confirmation message server's PID port. advanced users debugging, set verbose = TRUE see detailed console output installation graph preparation steps. full manual control, use lower-level functions like osrm_prepare_graph() osrm_start_server() directly.

title: Start an OSRM Server with Automatic Setup — osrm_start
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # copy example OSM PBF into a temporary workspace to avoid polluting pkg data   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   local_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = local_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)    # Start the server with one command.   # It will quietly install OSRM and prepare the graph if needed.   osrm_process <- osrm_start(local_pbf)    # Stop the server when done.   osrm_stop()    # To see all backend logs during setup, use verbose = TRUE   osrm_process_verbose <- osrm_start(local_pbf, verbose = TRUE)   osrm_stop()    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: Launches osrm-routed process pointing localized OSRM graph (either .osrm.mldgr MLD .osrm.hsgr CH/CoreCH).

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
code: osrm_start_server(   osrm_path,   version = FALSE,   help = FALSE,   verbosity = c("INFO", "ERROR", "WARNING", "NONE", "DEBUG"),   trial = FALSE,   ip = "0.0.0.0",   port = 5001L,   threads = 8L,   shared_memory = FALSE,   memory_file = NULL,   mmap = FALSE,   dataset_name = NULL,   algorithm = NULL,   max_viaroute_size = 500L,   max_trip_size = 100L,   max_table_size = 100L,   max_matching_size = 100L,   max_nearest_size = 100L,   max_alternatives = 3L,   max_matching_radius = -1L,   quiet = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   echo_cmd = FALSE )

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: osrm_path Character(1). Path .osrm.mldgr .osrm.hsgr file version Logical; TRUE, prints version exits help Logical; TRUE, prints help exits verbosity Character; one "NONE","ERROR","WARNING","INFO","DEBUG" trial Logical integer; TRUE >0, quits initialization (default: FALSE) ip Character; IP address bind (default: "0.0.0.0") port Integer; TCP port listen (default: 5001) threads Integer; number worker threads (default: 8) shared_memory Logical; load graph shared memory (default: FALSE) memory_file Character NULL; DEPRECATED (behaves like mmap) mmap Logical; memory-map data files (default: FALSE) dataset_name Character NULL; name shared memory dataset algorithm Character NULL; one "CH","CoreCH","MLD". NULL (default), auto-selected based file extension max_viaroute_size Integer (default: 500) max_trip_size Integer (default: 100) max_table_size Integer (default: 100) max_matching_size Integer (default: 100) max_nearest_size Integer (default: 100) max_alternatives Integer (default: 3) max_matching_radius Integer; use -1 unlimited (default: -1) quiet Logical; TRUE, suppresses package messages. verbose Logical; reserved controlling future server verbosity, included interface consistency osrm_start(). Defaults FALSE. echo_cmd Logical; echo command line console launch (default: FALSE)

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: processx::process object running server (also registered internally).

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
text: server's standard output error streams can controlled via R options non-interactive use persistent logging. default, captured pipes, allows reading output directly within R session (e.g., via osrm_server$read_output_lines()). redirect server's output one files, can set osrm.server.log_file R option calling function: Combined Log: send stdout stderr single file, provide file path: options(osrm.server.log_file = "path//osrm.log") Separate Logs: send stdout stderr separate files, provide named list: options(osrm.server.log_file = list(stdout = ".log", stderr = "err.log")) Default Behavior: restore default behavior using pipes, set option NULL: options(osrm.server.log_file = NULL) can override osrm-routed executable via options(osrm.routed.exec = "/full/path//osrm-routed").

title: Start an OSRM MLD/CH server with osrm-routed — osrm_start_server
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # Build a graph then launch an OSRM server on a custom port   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)    graph <- osrm_prepare_graph(     input_osm = tmp_pbf,     overwrite = TRUE,     threads = 1L,     algorithm = "mld"   )    server <- osrm_start_server(     osrm_path = graph$osrm_job_artifact,     port = 6000,     threads = 1L   )    # Later, stop the server again   osrm_stop(server)    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
text: Terminates osrm-routed process launched osrm_start() osrm_start_server().

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
code: osrm_stop(   server = NULL,   id = NULL,   port = NULL,   pid = NULL,   wait = 1000L,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
text: server Optional processx::process object returned osrm_start_server(). id Optional character id osrm_servers(). port Optional integer TCP port. pid Optional integer process id. wait Integer milliseconds wait clean shutdown (default 1000). quiet Logical; suppress messages (default FALSE).

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
text: list fields id, pid, port, stopped (logical).

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
text: function provides flexible way stop running OSRM process. arguments specified, defaults stopping recently started server still alive. can also stop specific server providing: processx::process object returned osrm_start() osrm_start_server(). server's id, port, pid (use osrm_servers() find ).

title: Stop an OSRM Server — osrm_stop
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # copy example OSM PBF into a temporary workspace to avoid polluting pkg data   pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   graph <- osrm_prepare_graph(tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE, threads = 1L)    srv <- osrm_start_server(graph$osrm_job_artifact, port = 6000, threads = 1L)    # Stop by passing the process object   osrm_stop(srv)    # Or stop by port after the process is registered   osrm_stop(port = 6000)    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

what: Stop all running OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_stop_all
title: Stop all running OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_stop_all
text: Stop running OSRM servers started via package

title: Stop all running OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_stop_all
code: osrm_stop_all()

title: Stop all running OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_stop_all
text: number servers attempted.

title: Stop all running OSRM servers started via this package — osrm_stop_all
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    pbf_path <- system.file("extdata/cur.osm.pbf", package = "osrm.backend")   osrm_dir <- file.path(tempdir(), paste0("osrm-", Sys.getpid()))   dir.create(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE)   tmp_pbf <- file.path(osrm_dir, "cur.osm.pbf")   file.copy(from = pbf_path, to = tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE)   graph <- osrm_prepare_graph(tmp_pbf, overwrite = TRUE, threads = 1L)    srv <- osrm_start_server(graph$osrm_job_artifact, port = 6000, threads = 1L)   stopped <- osrm_stop_all()   stopped    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )   unlink(osrm_dir, recursive = TRUE) } # }

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: Removes OSRM backend binaries optionally clears PATH configuration project's .Rprofile.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
code: osrm_uninstall(   dest_dir = NULL,   clear_path = TRUE,   quiet = FALSE,   all = FALSE,   force = FALSE )

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: dest_dir string specifying directory remove OSRM binaries. NULL (default), function looks installation per-version subdirectories inside tools::R_user_dir("osrm.backend", = "cache") removes . multiple versions installed, interactive sessions quiet prompted (numbered menu 0 cancel) choose directory; otherwise, dest_dir must supplied. Ignored = TRUE. clear_path logical value. TRUE (default), also removes PATH configuration project's .Rprofile calling osrm_clear_path(). quiet logical value. TRUE, suppresses informational messages confirmation prompts. Defaults FALSE. logical value. TRUE, removes OSRM installations found default cache directory. prompt confirmation unless force = TRUE. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, dest_dir parameter ignored. force logical value. TRUE, skips confirmation prompts, enabling non-interactive usage. Defaults FALSE.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
text: TRUE one directories successfully removed, FALSE otherwise.

title: Uninstall OSRM Backend Binaries — osrm_uninstall
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   # Install OSRM temporarily   install_dir <- osrm_install(path_action = "session", quiet = TRUE)    # Uninstall that specific version and clear PATH changes   osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   )    # If multiple installs exist, remove them all   osrm_uninstall(all = TRUE, force = TRUE, quiet = TRUE) } # }

what: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
title: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
text: Resolves osrm-routed executable available current PATH (override provided via options(osrm.routed.exec)). Runs osrm-routed --version verify availability, prints directory containing executable together backend version reported osrm-routed know used current session.

title: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
code: osrm_which(quiet = FALSE)

title: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
text: quiet Logical; FALSE (default), prints information located installation. TRUE, suppresses printed output returns information list.

title: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
text: list components executable (full path osrm-routed), directory (parent folder), osrm_version (character vector non-empty lines emitted osrm-routed --version), raw processx::run result logs.

title: Locate the OSRM Installation Used by osrm.backend — osrm_which
code: # \donttest{ if (identical(Sys.getenv("OSRM_EXAMPLES"), "true")) {   install_dir <- osrm_install(     version = "latest",     path_action = "session",     quiet = TRUE   )    # check which OSRM installation will be used   osrm_which()    osrm_uninstall(     dest_dir = install_dir,     clear_path = TRUE,     force = TRUE,     quiet = TRUE   ) } # }
